definition: to become aware/to detect/to realize/to perceive
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: I started to realize that it's the field that I have the most experience in.
sentences.chinese: 我开始发觉这是我经验最充足的一行。

sentences.english: Gradually, I can not run as fast as I did.
sentences.chinese: 渐渐地，我发觉自己跑得慢了下来。

sentences.english: I've always found her unbearably nosey.
sentences.chinese: 我发觉她总爱管闲事真让人受不了。

sentences.english: Poison Sense. Sense poison in 30-ft. radius .
Everytime you cut your hair, he is certainly to be the first person to find that.
sentences.chinese: 你每次剪了头发，他都会立即发觉。

sentences.english: Looked at the lights outside the car felt the first time found that all very strange.
sentences.chinese: 看着车外的灯火阑珊，第一次发觉所有很陌生。

sentences.english: Happiness is waking up and realizing that you are still alive.
sentences.chinese: 晨早起来，发觉自己仍然活着，那就是快乐。

sentences.english: You feel you can't walk around naked in your own flat.
sentences.chinese: 你发觉即便是在自家房子里也不能光着膀子走。

sentences.english: His crime escaped detection for many years.
sentences.chinese: 他的罪行许多年都未被发觉。

sentences.english: In order to avoid cloth, the farmers have found sitting on the taxi tracking cloth vesteralen.
sentences.chinese: 为了避免布有所发觉，农坐上敦的出租车跟踪布。

sentences.english: The more I studied, the more I recognized my ignorance.
sentences.chinese: 我学的越多，就越发觉自己的无知。

sentences.english: When I was very young, I noticed that my back was very elastic .
sentences.chinese: 当我很年轻，我发觉我的回是非常弹性。

sentences.english: She found it difficult to tune herself to a busy life.
sentences.chinese: 她发觉很难适应忙碌的生活。

sentences.english: Suddenly Ruz came face to face with a human skull!
sentences.chinese: 鲁茨突然发觉自己面对面地站在一个骷髅前。

sentences.english: The grafter was haunted by the fear of being discovered.
sentences.chinese: 那个受贿人因怕被人发觉而经常提心吊胆。

sentences.english: Dooku noticed that the Gold Team members were all scrambling to board a transport.
sentences.chinese: 杜库发觉金队队员都在争先恐后地登上飞行器。

definition: to realize suddenly/to wake up with a start
to sense/to perceive/to become aware of/to detect
to come to oneself/to come to realize/to come to see the truth/to wake up to reality
to feel/to sense/to detect/to perceive/to become aware
to sense/to perceive/to come to realize/to be aware
to be convinced/to be sure/to firmly believe/to be positive that/definite news
